snippet: Mario Manningham changed the flow of the game on a pass pattern taught to him as a high school player by Josh McDaniels’s father.
abstract: New York Giants receiver Mario Manningham's improbable 38-yard reception late in the fourth quarter of the Super Bowl changed the flow of the game and helped the Giants secure the game-winning touchdown; for Manningham, the catch of a lifetime was years in the making, coming on a pass pattern taught to him by his high school football coach Thom McDaniels, who is the father of New England Patriots offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels.
lead_paragraph: Mario Manningham changed the flow of the game on a pass pattern taught to him as a high school player by Josh McDaniels’s father.

headline.seo: For Manningham, Catch of a Lifetime Was Years in the Making
headline.main: For Giants’ Manningham, the Catch of a Lifetime Was Years in the Making
headline.print_headline: For Giants’ Manningham, the Catch of a Lifetime Was Years in the Making
